channel.title: Help! ill rep++ you
channel.description:
When i compile my client i get this error...
Class30_sub2_sub2_sub1_sub1.java:74: cannot access FileOperations bad class file: .\FileOperations.class class file has wrong version 50.0, should be 49.0 Please remove or make sure it appears in the correct subdirectory of the classpath Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolKit().createImage(FileOperations.ReadFiles(s));
1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .
How do i fix this? :confused: :|

item.title: Help! ill rep++ you
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

umm, that code is looking for an image people. Not a class, NOtice at the beginning it has “Image” if it is looking for an image it needs to be corrected (its not even the proper code for the image) i would personally try to delete that clause in the file, (after making a backup) and see what happens.

Read full topic

item.title: Help! ill rep++ you
item.dc:creator: @I_kasoy_II Sohail
item.description:
@I_kasoy_II wrote:

It says “please remove” if you want to fix it then remove it.

Read full topic

item.title: Help! ill rep++ you
item.dc:creator: @dagger9090 dagger9090
item.description:
@dagger9090 wrote:

No i dont think its looking for a background, since i have one like that, I tryed different FileOperations.class files, but i always get the same error… can someone help me… btw i get this with a lot of clients…

Read full topic

item.title: Help! ill rep++ you
item.dc:creator: @airborne airborne
item.description:
@airborne wrote:

I think it is asking you where the background picture is, but I’m not sure. Like, its looking for yourname.jpg.

That, or it is looking for your FileOperations.class. Try those.

Read full topic

item.title: Help! ill rep++ you
item.dc:creator: @dagger9090 dagger9090
item.description:
@dagger9090 wrote:

When i compile my client i get this error…

Class30_sub2_sub2_sub1_sub1.java:74: cannot access FileOperations
bad class file: .\FileOperations.class
class file has wrong version 50.0, should be 49.0
Please remove or make sure it appears in the correct subdirectory of the classpath
Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolKit().createImage(FileOperations.ReadFiles(s));

1 error
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

How do i fix this?
